intro: Calonyction mollissimum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its alternative name. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many climbing plants. Calonyction mollissimum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
